comments.commentBody:
The Atlantic recently published article entitled "How To Get Arrested On Moral Monday." It's an excellent read.

http://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2013/06/how-to-get-arrested-...

To Old Engineer:
Where in the ACA are doctors commanded by the state to work as doctors, or for free?

Nowhere, that's where.
Temper tantrum party--no health care, no action on climate change, no budget conference committee.
You do realize this is Obama's second term right?  You are copying and pasting the OLD talking points my friend.

David, you just revealed a major flaw in the law. You said a person needs heart surgery and does not have insurance, so can't have the surgery. But under Obamacare, he can buy insurance and have the surgery paid for. David, that's not "insurance", that's just paying for the surgery with fewer dollars. "Insurance" is to cover the cost of a risk that might occur in the future, not a known event that's already occured. Or do you think you can buy homeowners insurance the day after your house burns down and expect the insurance company to pay for your house  to be rebuilt?

I think much of the negative assault on the ACA is based on fear. Also Mitch McConnel and John Boehner's desire to make sure Obama is a one term president does not help.

I think a clear explanation of the ACA might convince more people to be for it.

Take the case of a patient needs heart surgery that will cost far more than the patient has. The patient is 52 years old and works for a company that does not offer insurance. The patient cannot get insurance and will have to forgo the surgery. With the ACA the patient can buy insurance and do the surgery.

I think most people including me would prefer the ACA option, which could literally keep them alive.

www.feelgoodtracker.com

the doctor: Your comment merits loud applause. A perfect description of the truly tragic  state of affairs on the GOP side of the aisle in both Houses of Congress. What is keeping these people in office?Thank you.

Nikia, on the planet that I live on, "hypocrites" are people who say one thing and do another. Republicans oppose ObamaCare; they are therefore trying to dismantle it. That makes them the opposite of hypocrites.

Tweaking existing laws happens when laws have been written with bipartisan support. ObamaCare was written and passed ENTIRELY by Democrats. It's their pig; let them find the best shade of lipstick.

Faceless, regardless of what political party the folks in Congress bow to, they are there FOR US and need to think about us, not their loyalty to the party they belong to.  If the law, passed by a MAJORITY, can be tweaked to make it better for us, it is their responsibility to do it, not sit back and hope it implodes.  You don't think so?  Then answer this: you work for a company and are in a group putting a strategy together.  You don't agree with the strategy the majority of the group wants, so what do you do?  Do you A. sit back, pout, and absolutely REFUSE to help all the while complaining very loudly to anyone who would listen, or do you B. accept this is the way the strategy is going and attempt to be a contributing member of your company, which is your job.  In most companies, option A would get you fired, but clearly not so in Congress.  So I'm sorry Faceless, saying the republicans have no responsibility to fix something you call a democrat problem is simply not true.

The delay in the employer mandate affects a small slice of employers, while any delay in the individual mandate would affect millions. Now why would the Republicans the defenders of the one percent, have such compassion for so many?
What a bunch of hypocrites! Why don't they stop all these shenanigans and work on making the Affordable Care Act work smoothly? I have read that the opponents of the law will not even consider small changes to the law to make it more efficient. This is something that happens routinely with almost any large legislation. Why can't the Republicans be sincere and try to work together to achieve the greater good?
Thank God for the Republicans in the House.

The Congression office staff?  The well paid public employees  on the taxpayer dole  who make the coffee for the congressmen?  Arrange the Senator's T-times?  Pick up the congresswomen's dry cleaning?     No benefits for three months?  hmmmmm ...   how about three years?

You and everyone else will be dancing in the streets if Obama decides not to spend billions and billions of your taxpayer dollars to meet the requirement sof the senate bill with regard to border security.  If the US Congress,primarily the Republican controlled House of Represesntatives could pass anything that is remotely realistic with regard to immigration, we wouldn't even be discussing immigration.  If they could have passed the Dream Act, the conversation would be quite different.

"Government hand outs won't solve what ails Detroit."

A new CBPP analysis of budget and Census data shows that more than 90 percent of the benefit dollars that entitlement programs spend go to assist people who are elderly and seriously disabled.

So to take your example, we take away that assistance rooted in our social contract as Americans and we abandon the elderly and the disabled, how does that cure what ails Detroit?

We then create another problem.

Any time anybody mentions something about Detroit's dilemma being "born of injustices that happened 30 years ago" they are just wasting everybodys time with the obvious. Yes injustices occurred back then. Racial and economic injustices also happened in NOLA, Atlanta and any number of southern cities as well as places like Capetown, RSA. All these places found a way to reinvent themselves for the better. So to can Detroit. Detroiters, it seems to me, are lacking a vision of a positive future. Instead of blaming your problems on others like racist surburbanites or an indifferent federal bureaucracy why not look inward. Much can be accomplished. Even if you are surrounded by vacant and blighted homes that's no excuse for not takiing the time to maintain your home.

What if the excellent (privately administered0 health insurance plan now open to all Federal employees, or by similar group plans to all state employees, were opened to the public at large  -- with all premiums fully deductible from taxable income? Like that idea? Deluge your elected representatives with email demanding it.  Remind them in the process that their own families are covered by such policies now. Why isn't  yours?

Len - thanks for the reply.
I still do not think you understand insurance - it is a personal choice of whether I - PERSONALLY - choose to accept a certain level of risk.
I am not MANDATED to have house insurance or disability insurance.
A mandated (undesired) insurance has another name - it is called a TAX.
Sorry SteveRR, but if you have a mortgage you'll be required to insure your property on behalf of your bank.

Mr. King doesn't care but you can bet it is not Mr. king we should be worried about. Employers around the country want this and every other labor law to go away. Their lobbyists are working run the clock to make that happen and the president is not adverse to cooperating. Young people want insurance but they cannot get it at reasonable rates. Young people cannot get real jobs because employers are allowed to hire them as independent contractors, with no benefits, no sick days, no insurance. He'll these kids cannot get three days paid leave to go to their grandmothers funeral. I a so sick to death of the corporate and employer victimhood.

Nice touch the way Mr. king wants to portray all his young employees as binge drinkers who would rather blow 200 on a bar bill than insurance. He must be a really nice guy to work for. He respects his employees so much!

Hatred destroyed the city of Detroit. The worst of white people and the worst of black people met here, bared their teeth, and joined in battle.  It is a long deadly silent war that rages on unabated; it broke into open rioting a few times the way a rotting wound occasionally, irrelevantly, exudes a little pus and continues to spread. There's a lot of lip service around diversity and unity, but I now believe the overwhelming majority of the population of the vast urban area centered in and including Detroit would only be happy with total racial separation.  Whatever race they are, whatever they say publically to outsiders.
There's politics that builds the Republic, and politics that tears it down.  Why can't the right wing make some constructive suggestions?

2010 was the end of the road for the Presidents agenda, whining about obstructionism doesn't help, it's called politics.  Elections have consequences, we lost and now we have to realize the House has the final say on ALL legislation going froward.  Man-up people!
You voted for a Republican? Then they are doing the job they were sent there to do. What's wrong with you?

Sir, that's what Marx, Lenin, Mao, and Fidel wanted -- control.

What you get -- huge messes and disasters.

And that is what most working Americans do not want.

If you replace five large restaurants with thirty small ones, do you think that prices will decline, stay the same, or increase?  Remember, every business has overhead costs, even before they sell their first meal.  Every business has a break-even dollar-volume.  In a relatively inelastic market, more businesses means dividing the available sales volume.  Pressure to make or exceed break-even results in increased prices unless costs somehow can be reduced.  What is a restaurant's biggest cost?  Bingo - labor.

It could actually be a good thing if this business stays afloat but does not expand. Maybe instead of turning restaurants like this into chains of eateries, the new law might encourage more competition by providing a point of entry for other people who may want to run competing businesses. This should benefit small business start-ups who want to compete against more established businesses. Competition would benefit consumers by encouraging better service at lower prices.

Excuse me, but didn't the Dems control the house due to gerrymandering back before 2010? Because of this law Pelosi lost the house and the Republicans gained 1000 seats in once Dem gerrymandered districts.
That was very dumb of the Dems because that was 2010, you know the year of the census? lol... go cry to Pelosi, Reid and Obama.
60% don't want it.

Every large employer should take advantage of this 1 year reprieve and cancel all health insurance plans immediately ...By not offering coverage and avoiding any penalty for doing so they would allow there employees to qualify for subsidy assistance. This would dump millions of Americans into the insurance exchanges. (That are not set up yet) The financial strain would completely and swiftly collapse the Affordable care act and end this monstrosity in the nexut 6 months.
Www.leebenhamassociates.com
Isn't that pretty much what happened under Reagan - the immigration thing?
They claimed it would cover more people and cost less. Both claims were bald faced lies, even ignoring my favorite, that we could keep our current insurance if we liked it.

Dave C: proves JLH's point.  I'm keeping my insurance, for one thing.  As for costs and coverage of people, how do we know yet.  Clearly, expanded medicaid coverage will insure more people in the risk group.  Nobody has a crystal ball, but at least it helps to make your arguments with a few facts.

Nowhere do I recall the backers of ACA saying that the act was perfect; rather, what they maintained is that it would markedly improve the health outcomes from millions of Americans and that it would, of course, require some fine-tuning as it took effect. I see the President's delay as common sense. Distortionists have so long damned the whole law that I'm afraid some less well informed people are buying the negative slams against the whole act.
How sad.

Wow, really? Soften up.  I said ethnically diverse not racially diverse.  Look up the difference.  Wyandotte, at the time, was made up of many first and second generation immigrants looking for work in the factories such as  Poles, Germans, Italians, Irish--are you from there?

Here is the proof:

All other industrialized countries have some form of universal government run health care, mostly single payor. They get better care as measured by all 16 of the bottom line public health statistics, and they do it at 40% of the cost per person. If our system were as efficient, we would save over $1.5 TRILLION each year.

www.pnhp.org & www.oecd.org, especially
http://www.oecd.org/dataoecd/46/2/38980580.pdf

@ ET Bass: Stop with these stupid, spurious posts. We don't have to "prove it" its proven daily by all the other first world countries around the world. Universal health care works, to say it doesn't at this point in time is tantamount to just lying outright. Are you a liar, E.T. Bass?

Len Charlap and CFW, ObamaCare is no big favor for low-income people who are forced to buy health insurance in exchanges. Their share of the premium and the co-pays will, on average, be at least as much as the average amount that people paid out of pocket when they were uninsured. But the taxpayers will be paying a LOT more! And it will be going to the insurance companies. It would have been less expensive, and solidly Constitutional, to simply expand the government programs that already paid for three-fourths of the health care costs that uninsured people didn't pay out-of-pocket.

droz is right. Many working in the food industry are "off" their parents insurance.
Restaurants manage their staffs so that most are not full time employees. We tax payers must fund the county ER, and doctors who once took the hit for a patient's lack of insurance, now have contracts that hospitals pay with bonus for volume irrespective of "no pays". Again, I am paying for the most expensive health care-the ER.
What will happen to people who can't afford insurance? Who have pre-existing conditions?  Why can't the right-wing try to solve a very real problem?  What's your alternative?
Minsf, how about charities instead of force?  How about you help these people and stop using a gun to force everyone else to?
minsf, go read Forbes. There are tons of plans by Avik Roy, for one. That's what happens when you quit relying on liberal media for all your "news."
The Affordable Heath Care should implode. The earlier it implodes, the more affordable the health care it will become!
It is a republican idea.  Thus it is even more expensive and burdensome.  All their ideas are.  Why do you think the tax code is so convoluted and burdensome?
